unit.utterance: užibcaw užiblekːu ca durħuˁ.
unit.utterance_translation: Once upon a time there was a boy.

unit.utterance: ilila atːala dužibcad macːala aq'.
unit.utterance_translation: His father had a herd of sheep.

unit.utterance: atːa ik'ulcaw durħuˁcːe, dila ʡaˁčurbe lednu, u ʡaˁbal bar uq'aˁn macːala q'ari.
unit.utterance_translation: The father said to the son: "I got a lot of work, go to herd the sheep for three days!"

unit.utterance: ca musːad k'ed ik'ulcaw kːalkme, warilla wari u iχtːaj erčimahark'utːa!
unit.utterance_translation: "In one place, there are", he says, "trees. Whatever happens, do not look at them!"

unit.utterance: ʡaˁħle ik'ulcaw durħuˁ, agurcaw ca ibil bar erčirawerč'iblekːu kːalkmaj, kajʁibcaw qili.
unit.utterance_translation: "Good," said the boy. He went the first day and didn't look at the trees and went back home.

unit.utterance: k'ʷi ibil bar agurcaw cel atːal il haʔibel ik'ul, pikri ik'ul užibcaw.
unit.utterance_translation: On the second day he went and thought: "Why did father say this?"

unit.utterance: kːalkmaj erčimaurk'utːa ik'ul, erčiwerč'iblekːu jaˁħ barq'ible.
unit.utterance_translation: "Don't look at the trees!", he said, and he was patient and did not look at the trees.

unit.utterance: ʡaˁbil bar agurcaw c'ilra, hatira χʷalle pikri ik'ulcaw.
unit.utterance_translation: (He) went the third day, and (he) thought about it even more.

unit.utterance: cellij atːal il haʔiblel, ce kːalkmejal ik'ul.
unit.utterance_translation: "Why did father say so, what kind of trees are these?" he said.

unit.utterance: užij ajχuble erčiwerč'ibcaw.
unit.utterance_translation: Not being able to resist, he looked (at the trees).

unit.utterance: čidažibcad χːula qːuʁa hincballa kːalkːi bužibcab, hel čihawquncaw.
unit.utterance_translation: He saw that they turned out to be big, beautiful apple trees, and he climbed upwards.

unit.utterance: welqːijsat ukuncaw, c'il dalli diqːanda ik'ul duklara dirc'an zamana sareʁibcar baˁžuk.
unit.utterance_translation: He ate until he was full. Then he thought to gather apples, and at the time when he was filling his shirt, Bazhuk [= a kind of witch] came.

unit.utterance: ha rik'ulcar hežuw ij, dila kːalkme, dila hincbe dukːan?
unit.utterance_translation: "Now", she said, "Is this the one who eats apples from my trees?"

unit.utterance: ucible, qːaple wikajšːibcab.
unit.utterance_translation: She caught (the boy) and put him into a sack.

unit.utterance: c'il rik'ulcar dam arillalij χurejglij wiqːanda.
unit.utterance_translation: "Then," she said, "I will carry him as food for myself during the day."

unit.utterance: ca musːa helila dacːi dik'ʷij dižible čirkasːible qːap agurcar qːʷat'agu dacːi darq'araj.
unit.utterance_translation: At some place she stopped to pee, took off the sack, and went to pee under the bushes.

unit.utterance: il durħuˁ tːurahawquncaw hel zamana qːaplicːer, daˁʡaˁna išːibcaw.
unit.utterance_translation: At this time that boy came out of the sack and hid himself.

unit.utterance: kareʁibcari ik' dacːi čirdarq'ible, čihasːibcab qːap, ax rik'ulcar il, dek'ʷ biχuble lebq'al iž.
unit.utterance_translation: She came back from peeing, took her sack, and said: "Ah, what has it become heavy!"

unit.utterance: cinna uruχdexlij dek'ʷ iχub urkːar rik'ul, berqːibcab il agurcar.
unit.utterance_translation: "Probably he became heavy because of his fear", she thought. She took the sack up and went on.

unit.utterance: riteʁible qili čirkasːibcab qːap.
unit.utterance_translation: When she reached home, she took off the sack.

unit.utterance: c'a gʷabiq'uncab, ħaˁšak čebišːible, rurčːur hadigarajsat karižibcar.
unit.utterance_translation: She set up a fire, put a pot onto it, and sat down and left it until it boiled

unit.utterance: rurčːur hadižibqːel, qːap čarbikabarq'ibcab ħaˁšukːa.
unit.utterance_translation: When (the water) boiled, she poured out the sack upside down into the pot,

unit.utterance: qːaplicːer qːarqne tːurakadeʁibcad.
unit.utterance_translation: Stones came out of the sack.

unit.utterance: ʡaˁsi riχuble il waˁw rik'ul.
unit.utterance_translation: She got angry and cried out:

unit.utterance: činawde u, rik'ulcar, at dul cik'al abirq'andan durħuˁcːe waše!
unit.utterance_translation: "Where are you?!" she said, "I won't do anything to you, come!",

unit.utterance: durħuˁ ik'ulcaw, du ala sunduq'lew wiw lewda.
unit.utterance_translation: and the boy said: "I am inside your box."

unit.utterance: ač barq'ibcab sunduq', errik'ulcar, wakːu.
unit.utterance_translation: She opened the box, looked but he was not there.

unit.utterance: c'ilra rik'ulcar wa durħuˁ at dul cik'al abirq'anda.
unit.utterance_translation: Then she said: "Boy, I won't do anything to you!"

unit.utterance: waše, tːura waše činawdel u bursa.
unit.utterance_translation: "Come, come outside! Say where you are!"

unit.utterance: durħuˁ ik'ulcaw, du ala nik'a t'uplew wiwda.
unit.utterance_translation: The boy said: "I am in your little finger!"

unit.utterance: qaˁškaʁibcab cinna nik'a t'up, wakːu.
unit.utterance_translation: She cut off her small finger, he wasn't there.

unit.utterance: c'ilra rik'ulcar, hatira ʡaˁsi riχuble, činawdekːʷa, u bursa!
unit.utterance_translation: And then she said, more angrily: "Tell me where you are!"

unit.utterance: durħuˁ ik'ulcaw, ala ħaˁšukːaw wiw lewda.
unit.utterance_translation: The boy said: "I am inside your pot."

unit.utterance: ħaˁšukːa čegurre it errikarurk'ulcar wiw χewel.
unit.utterance_translation: She went to the pot and looked inside, if he would be there.

unit.utterance: hel zamana taˁħ sauqunne durħuˁ, qːurt rikararq'ibcar hel ħaˁšukːari.
unit.utterance_translation: At this time, the boy jumped up and pulled her inside the pot.

unit.utterance: ħaˁšukːar rurqaˁn hinnicːer il rebč'ibcar.
unit.utterance_translation: In the water that boiled in the pot, she died.

unit.utterance: c'il derčible cinna macːara agurcaw qili.
unit.utterance_translation: Then he lead his sheep and went home.
